001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.IntMap;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectMap;
007import squidpony.squidmath.Bresenham;
008import squidpony.squidmath.Coord3D;
009import squidpony.squidmath.GWTRNG;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Queue;
013
014/**
015 * Provides utilities for working with colors as well as caching operations for
016 * color creation.
017 * <br>
018 * All returned SColor objects are cached so multiple requests for the same
019 * SColor will not create duplicate long term objects. Really, the right way to do
020 * this is to not use objects at all; Color and SColor have a {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
021 * method that gets a primitive float to represent the color exactly, without
022 * hassling the garbage collector. Most color-related operations are implemented
023 * for both Colors and floats that represent colors in SColor.
024 * <br>
025 * @see SquidColorCenter another technique for caching colors that allows filters.
026 * @see FilterBatch an alternative to SpriteBatch that allows filtering colors
027 *
028 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
029 * @author Tommy Ettinger - responsible for mutilating this class to work on libGDX
030 * 
031 * @deprecated You should use {@link SquidColorCenter} or pure SColor methods on floats instead.
032 */
033@Deprecated
034public class SColorFactory {
035
036    private final IntMap<SColor> valueLookup;
037    private GWTRNG rng;
038    private IntMap<SColor> colorBag;
039    private ObjectMap<String, ArrayList<SColor>> palettes;
040    private int floor;//what multiple to floor rgb values to in order to reduce total colors
041
042    /**
043     * Constructs a new SColorFactory with an empty cache.
044     * <br>
045     * Implementation note: SColorFactory initially used static methods and was not intended to
046     * be constructed by users, but for compatibility with Android (where static instances may
047     * linger into another run of an application), it was reworked to require an object to be
048     * constructed and for that object to contain the cache, rather than a static instance. Code
049     * written for earlier versions of SquidLib may use static methods on SColorFactory; most
050     * code written in SquidLib 3.0.0 beta 2 and newer prefers the IColorCenter implementations
051     * such as SquidColorCenter when SColor features such as color names aren't required. Since
052     * beta 4, SquidColorCenter implements most of SColorFactory's API, and also supports an
053     * IFilter for automatic changes to requested colors.
054     */
055    public SColorFactory() {
056
057        valueLookup = new IntMap<>();
058        rng = new GWTRNG();
059        colorBag = new IntMap<>();
060        palettes = new ObjectMap<>();
061        floor = 1;
062
063    }
064    
065    /**
066     * Returns the SColor whose value matches the one passed in. If no SColor
067     * constant matches that value, then a cached or new SColor is returned that
068     * matches the provided value.
069     *
070     * This method constructs a list of the SColor constants the first time it
071     * is called.
072     *
073     * @param argb an int encoding 256 * 256 * 256 * alpha + 256 * 256 * red + 256 * green + blue
074     * @return the SColor with value argb
075     */
076    public SColor colorForValue(int argb) {
077        if (valueLookup.size == 0) {
078            int len = SColor.FULL_PALETTE.length;
079            SColor sc;
080            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
081                sc = SColor.FULL_PALETTE[i];
082                valueLookup.put(Color.argb8888(sc), sc);
083            }
084        }
085
086        return valueLookup.containsKey(argb) ? valueLookup.get(argb) : asSColor(argb);
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Returns the number of SColor objects currently cached.
091     *
092     * @return
093     */
094    public int quantityCached() {
095        return colorBag.size;
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Utility method to blend the two colors by the amount passed in as the
100     * coefficient.
101     *
102     * @param a
103     * @param b
104     * @param coef
105     * @return
106     */
107    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
108        private int blend(int a, int b, double coef) {
109        coef = MathUtils.clamp(coef, 0, 1);
110        return (int) (a + (b - a) * coef);
111    }
112    /**
113     * Utility method to blend the two colors by the amount passed in as the
114     * coefficient.
115     *
116     * @param a
117     * @param b
118     * @param coef
119     * @return
120     */
121    private float blend(float a, float b, double coef) {
122        float cf = MathUtils.clamp((float)coef, 0, 1);
123        return (a + (b - a) * cf);
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Returns an SColor that is the given distance from the first color to the
128     * second color.
129     *
130     * @param color1 The first color
131     * @param color2 The second color
132     * @param coef The percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
133     * @return
134     */
135    public SColor blend(SColor color1, SColor color2, double coef) {
136        return asSColor(blend(color1.a, color2.a, coef),
137                blend(color1.r, color2.r, coef),
138                blend(color1.g, color2.g, coef),
139                blend(color1.b, color2.b, coef));
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Returns an SColor that is randomly chosen from the color line between the
144     * two provided colors from the two provided points.
145     *
146     * @param color1
147     * @param color2
148     * @param min The minimum percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
149     * @param max The maximum percent towards the second color, as 0.0 to 1.0
150     * @return
151     */
152    public SColor randomBlend(SColor color1, SColor color2, double min, double max) {
153        return blend(color1, color2, rng.between(min, max));
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Adds the two colors together.
158     *
159     * @param color1
160     * @param color2
161     * @return
162     */
163    public SColor add(SColor color1, SColor color2) {
164        return asSColor(color1.a + color2.a, color1.r + color2.r, color1.g + color2.g, color1.b + color2.b);
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Uses the second color as a light source, meaning that each of the red,
169     * green, and blue values of the first color are multiplied by the lighting
170     * color's percentage of full value (1.0).
171     *
172     * @param color
173     * @param light
174     * @return
175     */
176    public SColor lightWith(SColor color, SColor light) {
177        return asSColor((color.a * light.a), (color.r * light.r), (color.g * light.g), (color.b * light.b));
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Clears the backing cache.
182     *
183     * Should only be used if an extreme number of colors are being created and
184     * then not reused, such as when blending different colors in different
185     * areas that will not be revisited.
186     */
187    public void emptyCache() {
188        colorBag.clear();
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Sets the value at which each of the red, green, and blue values will be
193     * set to the nearest lower multiple of.
194     *
195     * For example, a floor value of 5 would mean that each of those values
196     * would be considered the nearest lower multiple of 5 when building the
197     * colors.
198     *
199     * If the value passed in is less than 1, then the flooring value is set at
200     * 1.
201     *
202     * @param value used to determine the precision of rounding
203     */
204    public void setFloor(int value) {
205        floor = Math.max(1, value);
206    }
207
208    /**
209     * Gets the value at which each of the red, green, and blue values will be
210     * set to the nearest lower multiple of.
211     * <br>
212     * For example, a floor value of 5 would mean that each of those values
213     * would be considered the nearest lower multiple of 5 when building the
214     * colors.
215     *
216     * @return the current floor value as a long, which defaults to 1.
217     */
218    public long getFloor() {
219        return floor;
220    }
221
222    /**
223     * Returns the cached color that matches the desired rgb value.
224     *
225     * If the color is not already in the cache, it is created and added to the
226     * cache.
227     *
228     * This method does not check to see if the value is already available as a
229     * SColor constant. If such functionality is desired then please use
230     * colorForValue(int rgb) instead.
231     *
232     * @param argb
233     * @return
234     */
235    public SColor asSColor(int argb) {
236        int working = argb;
237        if (floor != 1) {//need to convert to floored values
238            int a = (argb >>> 24) & 0xff;
239            a -= a % floor;
240            int r = (argb >> 16) & 0xff;
241            r -= r % floor;
242            int g = (argb >> 8) & 0xff;
243            g -= g % floor;
244            int b = (argb) & 0xff;
245            b -= b % floor;
246
247            //put back together
248            working = ((a & 0xFF) << 24)
249                    | ((r & 0xFF) << 16)
250                    | ((g & 0xFF) << 8)
251                    | (b & 0xFF);
252        }
253
254        if (colorBag.containsKey(working)) {
255            return colorBag.get(working);
256        } else {
257            SColor color = new SColor(working);
258            colorBag.put(working, color);
259            return color;
260        }
261    }
262    /**
263     * Returns the cached color that matches the desired rgb value.
264     *
265     * If the color is not already in the cache, it is created and added to the
266     * cache.
267     *
268     * This method does not check to see if the value is already available as a
269     * SColor constant. If such functionality is desired then please use
270     * colorForValue(int rgb) instead.
271     *
272     * @param a alpha, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
273     * @param r red, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
274     * @param g green, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
275     * @param b blue, between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
276     * @return an SColor with an unspecified name and the given a, r, g, and b values
277     */
278    public SColor asSColor(float a, float r, float g, float b) {
279        int aa = MathUtils.round(255 * a);
280        aa -= aa % floor;
281        int rr = MathUtils.round(255 * r);
282        rr -= rr % floor;
283        int gg = MathUtils.round(255 * g);
284        gg -= gg % floor;
285        int bb = MathUtils.round(255 * b);
286        bb -= bb % floor;
287
288        //put back together
289        final int working = ((aa & 0xFF) << 24)
290                | ((rr & 0xFF) << 16)
291                | ((gg & 0xFF) << 8)
292                | (bb & 0xFF);
293
294
295        if (colorBag.containsKey(working)) {
296            return colorBag.get(working);
297        } else {
298            SColor color = new SColor(working);
299            colorBag.put(working, color);
300            return color;
301        }
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Returns an SColor that is opaque.
306     *
307     * @param r red, between 0 and 255 inclusive
308     * @param g green, between 0 and 255 inclusive
309     * @param b blue, between 0 and 255 inclusive
310     * @return an SColor with an unspecified name, full (opaque) alpha, and the given r, g, and b values
311     */
312    public SColor asSColor(int r, int g, int b) {
313        return asSColor(255, r, g, b);
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Returns an SColor with the given values, with those values clamped
318     * between 0 and 255.
319     *
320     * @param a alpha, between 0 and 255 inclusive
321     * @param r red, between 0 and 255 inclusive
322     * @param g green, between 0 and 255 inclusive
323     * @param b blue, between 0 and 255 inclusive
324     * @return an SColor with an unspecified name and the given a, r, g, and b values
325     */
326    public SColor asSColor(int a, int r, int g, int b) {
327        a = Math.max(Math.min(a, 255), 0);
328        r = Math.max(Math.min(r, 255), 0);
329        g = Math.max(Math.min(g, 255), 0);
330        b = Math.max(Math.min(b, 255), 0);
331        return asSColor((a << 24) | (r << 16) | (g << 8) | b);
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Returns an SColor representation of the provided Color. If there is a
336     * named SColor constant that matches the value, then that constant is
337     * returned.
338     *
339     * @param color
340     * @return
341     */
342    public SColor asSColor(Color color) {
343        return colorForValue(Color.rgba8888(color.a, color.r, color.g, color.b));
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Returns an SColor that is a slightly dimmer version of the provided
348     * color.
349     *
350     * @param color
351     * @return
352     */
353    public SColor dim(SColor color) {
354        return blend(color, SColor.BLACK, 0.1);
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * Returns an SColor that is a somewhat dimmer version of the provided
359     * color.
360     *
361     * @param color
362     * @return
363     */
364    public SColor dimmer(SColor color) {
365        return blend(color, SColor.BLACK, 0.3);
366    }
367
368    /**
369     * Returns an SColor that is a lot darker version of the provided color.
370     *
371     * @param color
372     * @return
373     */
374    public SColor dimmest(SColor color) {
375        return blend(color, SColor.BLACK, 0.7);
376    }
377
378    /**
379     * Returns an SColor that is a slightly lighter version of the provided
380     * color.
381     *
382     * @param color
383     * @return
384     */
385    public SColor light(SColor color) {
386        return blend(color, SColor.WHITE, 0.1);
387    }
388
389    /**
390     * Returns an SColor that is a somewhat lighter version of the provided
391     * color.
392     *
393     * @param color
394     * @return
395     */
396    public SColor lighter(SColor color) {
397        return blend(color, SColor.WHITE, 0.3);
398    }
399
400    /**
401     * Returns an SColor that is a lot lighter version of the provided color.
402     *
403     * @param color
404     * @return
405     */
406    public SColor lightest(SColor color) {
407        return blend(color, SColor.WHITE, 0.6);
408    }
409
410    /**
411     * Returns an SColor that is the fully desaturated (greyscale) version of
412     * the provided color.
413     *
414     * @param color
415     * @return
416     */
417    public SColor desaturated(SColor color) {
418        int r = MathUtils.round(color.r * 255);
419        int g = MathUtils.round(color.g * 255);
420        int b = MathUtils.round(color.b * 255);
421
422        int average = (int) (r * 0.299 + g * 0.587 + b * 0.114);
423
424        return asSColor(average, average, average);
425    }
426
427    /**
428     * Returns an SColor that is the version of the provided color desaturated
429     * the given amount.
430     *
431     * @param color
432     * @param percent The percent to desaturate, from 0.0 for none to 1.0 for
433     * fully desaturated
434     * @return
435     */
436    public SColor desaturate(SColor color, double percent) {
437        return blend(color, desaturated(color), percent);
438    }
439
440    /**
441     * Returns a list of colors starting at the first color and moving to the
442     * second color. The end point colors are included in the list.
443     *
444     * @param color1 starting color
445     * @param color2 ending color
446     * @return an ArrayList of SColor going from color1 to color2; the length should be no greater than 256.
447     */
448    public ArrayList<SColor> asGradient(SColor color1, SColor color2) {
449        String name = paletteNamer(color1, color2);
450        if (palettes.containsKey(name)) {
451            return palettes.get(name);
452        }
453
454        //get the gradient
455        Queue<Coord3D> gradient = Bresenham.line3D(scolorToCoord3D(color1), scolorToCoord3D(color2));
456        ArrayList<SColor> ret = new ArrayList<>();
457        for (Coord3D coord : gradient) {
458            ret.add(coord3DToSColor(coord));
459        }
460
461        palettes.put(name, ret);
462        return ret;
463    }
464
465    /**
466     * Returns the palette associate with the provided name, or null if there is
467     * no such palette.
468     *
469     * @param name
470     * @return
471     */
472    public ArrayList<SColor> palette(String name) {
473        return palettes.get(name);
474    }
475    /**
476     * Returns the palette associate with the provided name, or null if there is
477     * no such palette.
478     *
479     * @param name
480     * @return
481     * @deprecated Prefer palette over this misspelled version.
482     */
483    public ArrayList<SColor> pallet(String name) {
484        return palettes.get(name);
485    }
486
487    /**
488     * Returns the SColor that is the provided percent towards the end of the
489     * palette. Bounds are checked so as long as there is at least one color in
490     * the palette, values below 0 will return the first element and values
491     * above 1 will return the last element;
492     *
493     * If there is no palette keyed to the provided name, null is returned.
494     *
495     * @param name
496     * @param percent
497     * @return
498     */
499    public SColor fromPalette(String name, float percent) {
500        ArrayList<SColor> list = palettes.get(name);
501        if (list == null) {
502            return null;
503        }
504
505        int index = Math.round(list.size() * percent);//find the index that's the given percent into the gradient
506        index = Math.min(index, list.size() - 1);
507        index = Math.max(index, 0);
508        return list.get(index);
509    }
510    /**
511     * Returns the SColor that is the provided percent towards the end of the
512     * palette. Bounds are checked so as long as there is at least one color in
513     * the palette, values below 0 will return the first element and values
514     * above 1 will return the last element;
515     *
516     * If there is no palette keyed to the provided name, null is returned.
517     *
518     * @param name
519     * @param percent
520     * @return
521     *
522     * @deprecated Prefer fromPalette over this misspelled version; they are equivalent.
523     */
524    public SColor fromPallet(String name, float percent) {
525        ArrayList<SColor> list = palettes.get(name);
526        if (list == null) {
527            return null;
528        }
529
530        int index = Math.round(list.size() * percent);//find the index that's the given percent into the gradient
531        index = Math.min(index, list.size() - 1);
532        index = Math.max(index, 0);
533        return list.get(index);
534    }
535
536    /**
537     * Places the palette into the cache, along with each of the member colors.
538     *
539     * @param name
540     * @param palette
541     * 
542     * @deprecated Prefer addPalette over this misspelled version; they are equivalent.
543     */
544    public void addPallet(String name, ArrayList<SColor> palette) {
545        addPalette(name, palette);
546    }
547
548    /**
549     * Places the palette into the cache, along with each of the member colors.
550     *
551     * @param name
552     * @param palette
553     */
554    public void addPalette(String name, ArrayList<SColor> palette) {
555        ArrayList<SColor> temp = new ArrayList<>();
556
557        //make sure all the colors in the palette are also in the general color cache
558        for (SColor sc : palette) {
559            temp.add(asSColor(sc.a, sc.r, sc.g, sc.b));
560        }
561
562        palettes.put(name, temp);
563    }
564
565    /**
566     * Converts the provided color into a three dimensional coordinate point for
567     * use in the Bresenham algorithms.
568     *
569     * @param color
570     * @return
571     */
572    private Coord3D scolorToCoord3D(SColor color) {
573        return new Coord3D(MathUtils.floor(color.r * 255), MathUtils.floor(color.g * 255), MathUtils.floor(color.b * 255));
574    }
575
576    /**
577     * Converts the provided three dimensional coordinate into a color for use
578     * in the Bresenham algorithms.
579     *
580     * @param coord
581     * @return
582     */
583    private SColor coord3DToSColor(Coord3D coord) {
584        return asSColor(coord.x, coord.y, coord.z);
585    }
586
587    private String paletteNamer(SColor color1, SColor color2) {
588        return color1.getName() + " to " + color2.getName();
589    }
590
591}
